fix.description: Add a <main> landmark wrapping your page content.
fix.code:
<main id="main-content">
  <!-- page content -->
</main>

landmark-one-main.impacted_users: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
landmark-one-main.expected: Page must contain exactly one <main> landmark element.

manual_test.description: Verify that the page content is structurally contained within the main landmark.
steps: Open the accessibility tree in DevTools.
Ensure it contains all unique page content (excluding header/footer).

fix.description: Wrap all visible content in semantic landmark elements.
fix.code:
<header><!-- header content --></header>
<main><!-- main content --></main>
<footer><!-- footer content --></footer>

region.impacted_users: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
region.expected: All visible page content must be contained within a landmark element (main, nav, header, footer, aside).

manual_test.description: Check for content outside of landmarks using a screen reader or landmark extension.
steps: Use a landmark bypass extension or screen reader command (e.g., 'R' in NVDA/JAWS).
Ensure no 'orphan' content exists outside of landmark regions.

fix.description: Add a descriptive alt attribute to every . Use alt="" for decorative images.

image-alt.impacted_users: Blind users relying on screen readers
image-alt.expected: Every must have an alt attribute. Decorative images use alt="".

fix.description: Give every button an accessible name via visible text or aria-label.
fix.code:
<!-- Via visible text: -->
<button>Submit form</button>
<!-- Icon button via aria-label: -->
<button aria-label="Close dialog"><svg aria-hidden="true">...</svg></button>

button-name.impacted_users: Screen reader users and voice control users
button-name.expected: Every <button> and [role="button"] must have a non-empty accessible name.

manual_test.description: Test button names using a screen reader or Inspect tools.
steps: Listen to the announced name; ensure it matches the button's action.

fix.description: Use descriptive link text that conveys the destination or purpose. Avoid "click here" or "read more".
fix.code: View our product catalog

link-name.impacted_users: Screen reader users and voice control users
link-name.expected: Every <a href> must have descriptive, non-empty text content or an aria-label.

manual_test.description: Examine the link text in isolation.
steps: Open the links list in a screen reader (e.g., JAWS Key + F7).
Check if links like 'Read More' are distinguishable without their surrounding text.

fix.description: Associate every form input with a visible <label> element.
fix.code:
<label for="email">Email address</label>
<input id="email" type="email" name="email">

label.impacted_users: Screen reader users and voice control users
label.expected: Every form input must have an associated <label>, aria-label, or aria-labelledby.

manual_test.description: Click the label text to ensure focus moves to the input.
steps: If the input field doesn't gain focus, the label is not correctly associated (missing 'for' or 'id' match).

fix.description: Increase the contrast ratio between text and its background. Minimum 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text (≥18pt or ≥14pt bold).

color-contrast.impacted_users: Users with low vision or color blindness
color-contrast.expected: Text contrast ratio must be at least 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text.

fix.description: All id attributes must be unique within the page. Search for duplicate values and rename them.

duplicate-id.expected: All id attributes must be unique within the document.

fix.description: Fix the heading hierarchy — no levels may be skipped.
fix.code:
Page title

Section heading

Subsection heading

heading-order.impacted_users: Screen reader users navigating by headings
heading-order.expected: Heading levels must not skip (h1 → h2 → h3, no gaps allowed).

fix.description: Add exactly one <h1> as the primary page heading.
fix.code: Main page heading

page-has-heading-one.impacted_users: Screen reader users navigating by headings
page-has-heading-one.expected: Page must have exactly one <h1> element as the primary heading.

fix.description: Add the required ARIA attribute(s) for the element's role. See the WAI-ARIA spec for required attributes per role.

aria-required-attr.expected: ARIA roles must include all required attributes defined in the WAI-ARIA spec.

fix.description: Set a valid value for the ARIA attribute. Consult the WAI-ARIA spec for the list of allowed values.

aria-valid-attr-value.expected: ARIA attributes must use only valid values defined in the WAI-ARIA spec.

fix.description: Remove aria-hidden="true" from elements that can receive focus, or exclude them from the tab order.
fix.code: Decorative text

aria-hidden-focus.impacted_users: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
aria-hidden-focus.expected: Elements with aria-hidden="true" must not be focusable.

fix.description: Remove positive tabindex values. Use tabindex="0" to include in natural tab order, tabindex="-1" to exclude.
fix.code:
Focusable element
Focus via script only

tabindex.expected: tabindex values must be 0 or -1. Positive values disrupt natural focus order.

fix.description: Add a valid autocomplete token to form inputs to assist users with autofill.
fix.code:
<input type="email" name="email" autocomplete="email">
<input type="text" name="name" autocomplete="name">
<input type="tel" name="phone" autocomplete="tel">

autocomplete-valid.impacted_users: Users with motor disabilities and cognitive disabilities

fix.description: Each form field must have exactly one associated <label>. Remove duplicate labels.
fix.code:
<!-- One label per input: -->
<label for="name">Full name</label>
<input id="name" type="text" name="name">

fix.description: Make scrollable regions keyboard-accessible by adding tabindex="0" and a descriptive label.
Associate every <select> element with a visible <label>.
fix.code:
<label for="country">Country</label>
<select id="country" name="country">
  <option value="us">United States</option>
</select>

select-name.impacted_users: Screen reader users and voice control users

fix.description: Add an alt attribute to every <input type="image"> describing the action it performs.
fix.code: <input type="image" src="submit.png" alt="Submit form">

input-image-alt.impacted_users: Blind users relying on screen readers

fix.description: Add an aria-label to every <object> element describing its content.
fix.code:
<object data="chart.svg" type="image/svg+xml" aria-label="Bar chart: Q1 2024 sales by region">
  Fallback text for unsupported browsers
</object>

object-alt.impacted_users: Blind users relying on screen readers

fix.description: Add a descriptive title attribute to every <iframe>.
fix.code:
<iframe
  title="Embedded map showing our store location"
  src="https://maps.example.com/embed"
></iframe>

fix.description: Add a descriptive, unique <title> element to every page.
fix.code: <title>Product Details — My Store</title>

document-title.impacted_users: Screen reader users and users with cognitive disabilities
document-title.expected: Page must have a descriptive, unique <title> element.

fix.description: Add a lang attribute to the <html> element so screen readers pronounce content correctly.
fix.code: <html lang="en">

html-has-lang.impacted_users: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)
html-has-lang.expected: The <html> element must have a lang attribute.

fix.description: Use a valid BCP 47 language tag on the <html> element.
fix.code:
<!-- English -->
<html lang="en">
<!-- French Canadian -->
<html lang="fr-CA">
<!-- Brazilian Portuguese -->
<html lang="pt-BR">

html-lang-valid.impacted_users: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)
html-lang-valid.expected: The lang attribute on <html> must be a valid BCP 47 language tag.

fix.description: Use a valid BCP 47 language code on any element with a lang attribute.
fix.code:
Hola mundo

Citation en français

valid-lang.impacted_users: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)

fix.description: Add a skip link at the very top of each page so keyboard users can bypass repetitive navigation.
fix.code: Skip to main content

bypass.impacted_users: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
bypass.expected: Page must provide a mechanism to skip repetitive navigation (e.g., a skip link).

fix.description: Remove automatic page refresh. If redirecting immediately, a delay of 0 is permitted.
fix.code:
<!-- Remove this: -->
<!-- <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="5; url=..."> -->

<!-- Instant redirect only (delay=0 is OK): -->
<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; url=https://example.com/new-page">

meta-refresh.impacted_users: Users with cognitive disabilities and screen reader users

fix.description: Remove user-scalable=no from the viewport meta tag to allow users to zoom.
fix.code: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">

meta-viewport.impacted_users: Users who need to zoom (low vision, motor disabilities)
meta-viewport.expected: Viewport meta must not disable user scaling (user-scalable=no is forbidden).

fix.description: Interactive elements must have a minimum target size of 24×24 CSS pixels (WCAG 2.5.8). Larger targets (44×44 px) are recommended for touch interfaces.

target-size.impacted_users: Mobile/touch users and users with motor disabilities
target-size.expected: All interactive targets must be at least 24×24 CSS pixels (WCAG 2.5.8). Spacing or a larger equivalent target is an acceptable alternative.

fix.description: The focus indicator must cover a minimum area (perimeter × 2 CSS px) and maintain a 3:1 contrast ratio between focused and unfocused states (WCAG 2.4.11).

focus-appearance.impacted_users: Keyboard-only users and users with low vision
focus-appearance.expected: Focus indicators must be clearly visible, with a minimum area of the component perimeter × 2 CSS px and a 3:1 contrast ratio between focused and unfocused states (WCAG 2.4.11).

fix.description: All drag-and-drop functionality must have a single-pointer alternative (e.g., click-to-select then click-to-drop, or arrow buttons) for users who cannot perform drag gestures (WCAG 2.5.7).
fix.code: • Item 1

dragging-movements.impacted_users: Users with motor disabilities who cannot perform drag gestures
dragging-movements.expected: All drag-and-drop functionality must have an equivalent single-pointer alternative operable without dragging (WCAG 2.5.7).

fix.description: Do not require users to re-enter information already provided in the same session (WCAG 3.3.7). Pre-populate fields or provide a copy option.
fix.code:
<!-- Pre-populate from session data: -->
<label for="ship-address">Shipping address</label>
<input id="ship-address" type="text" autocomplete="shipping street-address"
  value="{{ session.billing_address }}">

<!-- Or offer a checkbox: -->
<label>
  <input type="checkbox" id="same-as-billing">
  Same as billing address
</label>

redundant-entry.impacted_users: Users with cognitive disabilities and motor disabilities
redundant-entry.expected: Information already submitted during the same session must be auto-populated or selectable without requiring re-entry (WCAG 3.3.7).

fix.description: Authentication must not require solving a cognitive test (CAPTCHA, puzzle, memorization) without providing an accessible alternative (WCAG 3.3.8).
fix.code: Use audio CAPTCHA instead

accessible-auth-minimum.impacted_users: Users with cognitive disabilities (dyslexia, memory impairments)
accessible-auth-minimum.expected: Authentication processes must not require solving a cognitive function test without providing an accessible alternative method (WCAG 3.3.8).

fix.description: Help mechanisms (support link, chat, contact info, self-help tool) must appear in the same relative order on every page where they appear (WCAG 3.2.6).
fix.code: Help centre Contact support

consistent-help.impacted_users: Users with cognitive disabilities who rely on consistent page layouts
consistent-help.expected: Help mechanisms must appear in the same relative order on every page where they are provided (WCAG 3.2.6).
